thread.title: Nebius Group (NBIS) Is Up 20.8% After Blackwell AI Cloud Deal Wins With Microsoft And Meta - Has The Bull Case Changed?
thread.title_full: Nebius Group (NBIS) Is Up 20.8% After Blackwell AI Cloud Deal Wins With Microsoft And Meta - Has The Bull Case Changed?

author: Simply Wall St
title: Nebius Group (NBIS) Is Up 20.8% After Blackwell AI Cloud Deal Wins With Microsoft And Meta - Has The Bull Case Changed?
text:
Nebius Group (NBIS) Is Up 20.8% After Blackwell AI Cloud Deal Wins With Microsoft And Meta – Has The Bull Case Changed? Simply Wall St Thu, 25 December 2025 at 7:10 am GMT+2 3 min read
In this article: Earlier this month, Nebius Group launched Nebius AI Cloud 3.1, rolling out NVIDIA Blackwell Ultra-based infrastructure, real-time capacity tools, and stricter security and governance features for its full-stack AI cloud platform.
These upgrades, combined with very large multi-year AI infrastructure agreements with Microsoft and Meta, deepen Nebius’s role as an AI infrastructure provider while heightening execution and funding demands.
With Nebius now deploying Blackwell Ultra systems in production, we’ll explore how this changes the company’s investment narrative and risk profile.
The end of cancer? These 29 emerging AI stocks are developing tech that will allow early identification of life changing diseases like cancer and Alzheimer's.
Nebius Group Investment Narrative Recap To own Nebius, you have to believe that demand for high performance AI infrastructure will stay strong enough for the company to scale capacity, execute its mega-deals with Microsoft and Meta, and move toward sustainable profitability despite heavy capital needs and stock volatility. The Nebius AI Cloud 3.1 launch reinforces that core thesis by putting Blackwell Ultra into production, but it does not materially change the key near term catalyst of capacity build-out and delivery against those contracts, or the biggest risk around funding and execution.
Among recent announcements, the multi year Microsoft AI infrastructure agreement, valued at over US$19 billion, is the most relevant context for Nebius AI Cloud 3.1. The new Blackwell Ultra based platform and real time capacity tools are what Nebius must lean on to reliably serve that take or pay style contract, which in turn underpins expectations for rapid revenue growth and heightens the importance of managing capital intensity and customer concentration.
But while the growth story is appealing, investors should also be aware that customer concentration and funding needs could...
Read the full narrative on Nebius Group (it's free!)
Nebius Group's narrative projects $3.2 billion revenue and $428.7 million earnings by 2028.
Uncover how Nebius Group's forecasts yield a $159.29 fair value , a 75% upside to its current price.
Exploring Other Perspectives NBIS 1-Year Stock Price Chart Thirty one members of the Simply Wall St Community currently see Nebius’s fair value anywhere between US$15.07 and US$159.29, reflecting sharply different expectations. As you weigh those views, remember that Nebius’s ability to finance and execute its massive Microsoft and Meta infrastructure commitments may be just as important as headline growth when thinking about the company’s future performance.
